title: Emergency Vehicles Quiz
description: Test your recall of the vehicles that rush to help in emergencies

questions.question: The 'Jaws of Life' hydraulic rescue tool is most commonly found on which emergency vehicle?
What is the primary purpose of a 'ladder truck' in a fire department?
options: Providing an extendable aerial ladder for high-rise rescue

questions.question: An ambulance equipped for advanced life support typically carries what medical professional?
A 'pumper truck' (fire engine) is designed primarily to do what at a fire scene?
options: Pump water through hoses to fight fires

questions.question: Coast Guard cutters are emergency vessels used primarily for what?
options: Maritime search and rescue, law enforcement, and safety

questions.question: A 'crash tender' or ARFF vehicle is stationed at what type of location?
What color are most fire engines traditionally painted in the United States?
A 'hazmat' vehicle is specially equipped to handle what?
What is a 'tiller truck' in firefighting?
options: A truck that carries tillage equipment
A truck used only for brush fires
A hook-and-ladder truck with a separately steered rear section

questions.question: Emergency vehicles use sirens and lights to do what?
options: Signal that the emergency is over
Alert other drivers to yield the right of way

questions.question: A 'rescue boat' operated by fire departments is primarily used for what?
options: Water rescue of drowning or stranded people
Putting out fires on the water

questions.question: What does a 'mobile command center' vehicle serve as during a large emergency?
options: A centralized coordination and communications hub

questions.question: A 'snowcat' or tracked rescue vehicle is used for emergency response in what conditions?
The 'Star of Life,' a blue six-pointed star, is commonly displayed on which emergency vehicle?
A fire department's 'tanker truck' (or water tender) is primarily used for what?
options: Transporting large volumes of water to areas without hydrants
